p: Lentic and temporal aquatic habitats are essential for mosquito development, supporting the growth and survival of immature stages of the vectors [ 44, 45]. Though the immature stages of arboviral mosquito vectors may develop in aquatic habitats devoid of plants, like in Aedes aegypti [ 44], most arboviral mosquito vectors including Culex, Mansonia, and other Aedes species preferentially develop in or are attracted to water habitats containing plants or plant debris [ 45].
